summary: The document is a payroll certification report for the U.S. House of Representatives' Select Committee on Assassinations, covering the accounting period from December 1, 1977, to December 31, 1977. It details employees' names, social security numbers, job titles, annual gross pay, and period earnings, with remarks for certain entries, offering a glimpse into the committee's staffing and financial operations during this period.
key_findings: The payroll includes a wide range of positions from staff investigators and counsel to secretaries and document clerks.
Salary limits for the period were set at a minimum of $1,200.00 and a maximum of $47,500.00.
Several entries include remarks about payroll changes or appointments during the period.
The document provides insight into the staffing and financial operations of the Select Committee on Assassinations during this time.
